content: I have two pages in Backdrop; an About node and a Testimonials view. Rather than adding Testimonials to the main menu, I'd like to display it on the About page as a seperate tab (e.g. click About in menu go to page with two tab; first selected is About node, second is Testimonials and shows that view when clicked). These would be seperate from the View/Edit/etc. tabs, don't want to mess with those. Any ideas how best to do this?
Not at the computer atm, but Field Group?
Oh yes, sure! I guess I didn't really think about your question, sorry!
In Drupal, there is the Quick Tabs module, https://www.drupal.org/project/quicktabs.

@BWPanda (Peter) You already said you don't want to mess with main tabs, but maybe this is interesting, though:
https://drupal.stackexchange.com/questions/20904/menu-secondary-tabs

Menu secondary tabs
How do I create secondary local tasks with hook_menu in Drupal 7? For instance, if I wanted to add a new tab to a node, that presented multiple tasks beneath it? View Edit Update Price Photo Person
@BWPanda (Peter) https://www.drupal.org/project/node_tab is also an interesting implementation, but the module is still in beta, w/o any new release since 2013, and its usage count is ~150 sites.
...quicktabs on the other hand seems to be popular, with close to 60k sites using the 7.x version. Perhaps it's worth porting over.
